title.narrative: Professional development - Science and Innovation Human Resource Training

description.narrative:
Building capacity for Vietnam Science and Innovation (“S and I”) human resources: Supporting dialogue and knowledge exchange on S and I governance and strategic research policy development between Vietnam and the UK
Strand 1: PDE – 2019 –research skills training • Supporting researcher’s training skills based on the Research Development Framework i.e. project management, proposal and bid writing, communications, research impacts, IP ect.
Strand 2: PDE – 2019 - research management and governance skills training
Strand 3: PDE – 2019 - support research group collaboration VN - UK
With MOET Enhancing the research ecosystem within the Vietnam universities through development of a research evaluation matrix that help look at research performance of higher education institutions. This will support Ministry of Education and Training Vietnam universities and research institutes to develop measures/indicators for quality research development that benchmark to international standards in the short run. In the long run, this helps prepare S and I human resources for Vietnam to tackle the national and global challenges; enhance S and I human resources for Vietnam toward international standard across full academic spectrum within VN HE system, increase institutional & sectoral capacity, support the policy change to improve the HE research system in Vietnam; and this can be a base for MOET to consider development of a REF alike framework for Vietnam to use as a tool in distributing government funding to support research in a long run; to help MOET/HE sector to benchmark research institutions nationally & internationally; to use as a tool for HE sectors attract research funding from funding organisations (business/ international donors/ government).

S,T&I managers at central and local levels will be trained by UK experts on issues relating to policy development, S&T managements, IP etc. The programme builds capacity in-country to better manage STI in a way that maximises benefits to their economy and solve development challenges.
